title.narrative: Global Procurement Initiative: Procurement Assistance Program for Jamaica, through Meridian International Center

description.narrative: This Global Procurement Initiative: Procurement Assistance Program for Jamaica: Phases I and II, Training Webinars, and Virtual Roundtable is a national-level Program that encompasses four separate training components: 1) a three-day GPI Workshop in Kingston, Jamaica for about 60 government procurement officials and up to 15 observers in Spring 2019; 2a) a Value-Based Procurement Study Tour for two distinct cohorts of 15 senior Jamaican federal procurement officials, totaling 30 delegates overall, in Spring and Summer 2020; 3) three training webinars led by the GPI's technical experts between components to increase collaboration and knowledge sharing; and, 4) a virtual Workshop and Study Tour Roundtable and Panel Event (Roundtable) for all Jamaican procurement officials trained through the GPI to discuss their success, challenges, and strategies, as well as evaluate areas for further collaboration under the program. The components would be carried out in collaboration with GoJ's Office of Public Procurement (OPP), the George Washington University Law School's Government Procurement Law Program (GW), and USTDA's GPI technical specialists.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

The components would be carried out in collaboration with Government of Jamaica (GOJ) Office of Public Procurement (OPP), the George Washington University Law School's Government Procurement Law Program (GW), and USTDA's GPI technical specialists.

title.narrative: JPS New Kingston Smart City, through Tuatara Group, LLC

description.narrative: The JPS New Kingston Smart City Technical Assistance supports Jamaica Public Service Company Limited in determining the technical, financial, and economic viability of a proposed smart city project for Jamaica. The technical assistance would define up to four smart cities technologies or services for deployment in the demonstration program in New Kingston, and potentially across Jamaica.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - GPI: TA for the Ministry of Finance and Public Service, Government of Jamaica, through Enterprise - United States Unknown

description.narrative: This technical assistance grant provides funding for an advisory team to assist the Ministry of Finance and Public Service within the Government of Jamaica under the Procurement Assistance Program (Program) for Jamaica under USTDAs Global Procurement Initiative: Understanding Best Value (GPI). The TA will develop recommendations and manuals to assist the Government of Jamaica in (i) implementing international best practices for achieving value for money in public procurement and (ii) improving the capacity of public procurement staff across the government.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Emergency Communications System Modernization Technical Assistance, through Enterprise - United States Unknown

description.narrative: This technical assistance grant for the Ministry of Science, Energy and Technology provides funding support for the development of a modernized and unified emergency communications system in Jamaica. The project would include the creation of a consolidated emergency communications system at the national level, as well as implementation of technological and operational upgrades to improve the countrys emergency response capabilities. This technical assistance would support climate change adaptation by strengthening emergency response and communications capacity for climate-change related disasters such as severe storms and hurricanes, which disproportionately affect Caribbean islands. Project implementation would provide commercial opportunities for U.S. companies to export goods and services related to emergency communications technologies and solutions.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Broadband Network Expansion Technical Assistance, through Enterprise - United States Unknown

description.narrative: This technical assistance grant for RJRGLEANER Communications Group (RJRGLEANER) provides funding support for the deployment of a national broadband network in Jamaica (the project). The technical assistance would evaluate the technical and commercial options for deploying broadband internet infrastructure in underserved areas in Jamaica, recommend a range of technological solutions, and create a roadmap for broadband expansion throughout the country. Project implementation would provide commercial opportunities for U.S. companies to export goods and services related to broadband network technologies and solutions.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - JAMAICA: TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE: REHABILITATION OF PRIORITY WASTEWATER FACILITIES, through Government of Jamaica

description.narrative: This $150,000 grant funds technical assistance (TA) for Jamaica's National Water Commission (NWC) for a wastewater facility rehabilitation pilot project. This TA will enable the NWC, a statutory body established through an Act of the Jamaican parliament, to improve its ability to evaluate wastewater treatment facility upgrade needs in order to comply with environmental regulations and to improve wastewater treatment facility performance. This project is one of two projects brought to USTDA in connection with the Caribbean Regional Fund for Wastewater Management (CReW), which is financed and managed by the Inter- American Development Bank (IDB). The second pilot project associated with CReW is in Belize and is a separate activity.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Petroleum Corporation of Jamaica (PCJ) Wind Farm, through Keystone Engineering Inc.

description.narrative: The PCJ Wind Farm Feasibility Study will support the Petroleum Corporation of Jamaica in developing a 50 MW to 90 MW offshore wind farm in Jamaica. The project will offer commercial opportunities for a range of U.S. equipment and services related to wind power generation.

title.narrative: NWC Third-Party Financing for Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy, through Resource Mobilization Advisors

description.narrative: This technical assistance would help the National Water Commission (NWC) of Jamaica to reduce energy use and costs by screening energy efficiency and renewable energy opportunities at four NWC administrative buildings and the ten highest energy-consuming NWC facilities to propose four energy efficiency projects and three renewable energy projects for implementation. For each of the proposed projects, the technical assistance will develop detailed technical, economic, and environmental feasibility studies, as well as off-balance sheet financing mechanisms. This project supports the goals of the Clean Energy Finance Facility for the Caribbean and Central America (CEFF-CCA).
